title: Public transport for the A-League Round 22 – Melbourne Victory v Central Coast Mariners: Saturday 8 March 2025
articleContent:
A-League continues at AAMI Park as Melbourne Victory takes on Central Coast Mariners.

Public transport is your best way to enjoy the action and we're running extra services to help you get home from AAMI Park on Saturday 8 March.

Kick-off is at 7:35 pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. Check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Note: Buses replace trains on the Hurstbridge Line between Heidelberg and Eltham during this time.

Buses also replace trains on the Upfield Line between North Melbourne and Upfield during this time.

 Metropolitan train

Return trains from Richmond Station

  • Ringwood - leaving at 10:03pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley - leaving at 9:59pm from Platform 10
  • Dandenong - leaving at 9:56pm from Platform 6
  • Frankston - leaving at 9:52pm Platform 4
  • Sandringham - leaving at 9:54pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Catch a Route 70 tram between Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Melbourne Showgrounds

Catch a Route 246 bus close to AAMI Park.

 Regional train

Normal trains leave from Southern Cross Station.
